definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: be senseless, foolish (NH [[נְבָלָה]], [[נַבְלוּת]] of immodesty; Ar.nabula = (per contra) be noble, distinguished, nabala also be gracious (Frey); Aram. [[נְבַל]] Pa. reject, despise, v. Targum Ne 3:6, Je 14:21; in deriv. as NH);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. 2 ms. [[נׇבַלְתָּ]] Pr 30:32 if thou hast been foolish in lifting up thyself (opp. [[זַמּוֹתָ]]).

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Pf. 1 S. sf. consec. [[וְנִבַּלְתִּיח]] Na 3:6; Impf. 3 ms. [[וַיְנַבֵּל]] De 32:15; 2 ms. [[תְּנַבֵּל]] Je 14:21; Pt. [[מִנַבֵּל]] Mic 7:6; —regard or treat as a [[נׇבָל]] (q.v.), i.e. with contumely, c.acc.: [[בֵּן מְנַבֵּל אָב]] Mic 7:6 son treateth father as a fool (with contumely); ´[[וַיְנ]] [[חוּר]] De 32:15 and he treated with contumely the Rock of his salvation (i.e. ´[[י]]; ‖[[נטשִׁ]]); ´[[י]] subj., Na 3:6 I will treat thee (Nineveh) with contumely (‖[[וְהִשְׂלַכְתִּ֫י חָלַיִךְ שִׁקֻּחִים]]); Je 14:21 do not treat with contumely the throne of thy glory (‖[[נאץ]]).
